articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli strikes in the West Bank killed at least nine people, Palestinian health authorities said on Wednesday, in a major operation in the occupied territory.
articles.title: Israeli operation in the West Bank kills at least 9, Palestinian officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian drones set oil tanks on fire at an depot in Russia's Rostov region, Russian Telegram channels reported on Wednesday.
articles.title: Ukraine drones set oil depot ablaze in Russia's Rostov region, Telegram channels say

articles.author: Giulia Paravicini, Maggie Michael
articles.description: The U.N. World Food Program is investigating two of its top officials in Sudan over allegations including fraud and concealing information from donors about its ability to deliver food aid to civilians amid the nation’s dire hunger crisis, according to 11 people with knowledge of the probe.
articles.title: Exclusive: WFP launches probe into its Sudan operations as famine spreads

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ship engineer Tim Parker Eaton is the second crew member from British tech tycoon Mike Lynch's sunken superyacht to be placed under investigation by Italian prosecutors, a judicial source said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Ship engineer from Lynch's sunken yacht also under investigation, legal source says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: French investigative judges are due to decide later on Wednesday whether to place Russian-born Telegram boss Pavel Durov under formal investigation following his arrest as part of a probe into organised crime on the messaging app.
articles.title: French judges to decide on next step in Durov probe

articles.author: Kaori Kaneko
articles.description: Southwestern Japan braced on Wednesday for what officials say could be one of the strongest storms to ever hit the region, as some residents in the path of Typhoon Shanshan were ordered to evacuate and major firms like Toyota closed factories.
articles.title: Japan issues emergency warning as powerful Typhoon Shanshan nears

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Protesters blocked train tracks, stopped buses and shouted slogans in the eastern Indian state of West Bengal on Wednesday, the latest in a series of protests that have rocked the state since the rape and murder of a trainee doctor.
articles.title: Protesters block train tracks, buses in eastern India

articles.author: Andrew Macaskill
articles.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer will discuss a landmark economic and defence accord with German leaders on Wednesday, hoping to use a two-day visit to the European Union's top powers Germany and France to reset relations with the rest of the bloc.
articles.title: UK's Starmer in Berlin for talks to reset ties with Europe

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pope Francis on Wednesday strongly decried the treatment of migrants crossing the Mediterranean Sea to enter Europe, saying it was a "grave sin" not to offer aid to migrant vessels.
articles.title: Pope Francis says refusing aid to migrants a 'grave sin'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Indonesia's anti-graft agency plans to ask the youngest son of President Joko "Jokowi" Widodo to clarify his use of a private jet on a recent overseas trip as well as who paid for the travel, its deputy chief said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Indonesia's anti-graft body plans to query president's son about private jet trip
